intro: Cordylanthus bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, known for its distinctive yellow to orange flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, sparsely branched inflorescences. Cordylanthus bolanderi is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native range.
